description: A military coup attempt is underway in Bolivia. Hundreds of troops and armored vehicles have taken to the streets of La Paz, surrounding the governmental palace and using tear gas on demonstrators.
title: A military coup attempt is underway in Bolivia, with troops and tanks on the streets

description: California's wildfire risk is so high, numerous insurance companies have left the state. Now, the insurance commissioner has presented a new plan to entice them to return.
title: California hopes to lure insurance companies back with extreme regulation overhaul

description: The CDC warns of increased risk of dengue in the U.S. This been a record-breaking year for cases of this mosquito-borne virus in Central and South America, with more than 9 million cases reported.
title: U.S. is seeing increased risk of dengue infections, health officials warn

description: Julian Assange avoids a trial or further jail time in the U.S. for posting classified documents, but his plea deal suggests journalists cannot count on sidestepping prosecution for publishing such government secrets.
title: What Julian Assange's plea deal means for journalists who expose government secrets

description: As the justices were announcing opinions on other matters, the court briefly posted a decision that would reinstate a lower court order allowing hospitals in Idaho to perform emergency abortions.
title: Supreme Court has another embarrassing misstep in the release of an abortion opinion

description: A government program made to lift the poorest disabled and elderly people out of poverty is so out-of-date and complex that people often get kicked off. The agency that runs the program responds.
title: Social Security Commissioner Martin O'Malley agrees SSI program is outdated

description: Homeland Security's latest report shows a 40% decrease in border arrests, three weeks after President Biden’s asylum restrictions and expedited removals executive actions took effect.
title: Unauthorized migrants crossings have gone down significantly since executive actions

description: Insurance companies are covering fewer drugs than they did in 2010, and they’re making patients jump through more hoops and pay more money to get them. A report from GoodRx documents the issues.
title: Insurance covers fewer drugs than in 2010 and they're harder to get

description: Israel has banned most critically ill and severely wounded patients from being evacuated for medical treatment, according to the United Nations and other groups. Now it appears that may be changing.
title: Medical groups challenge Israel's ban on evacuations from Gaza. Is Israel relenting?

description: Armored vehicles rammed into the doors of Bolivia's government palace as President Luis Arce said the country faced an attempted coup, insisted he stands firm and urged people to mobilize.
title: Bolivia's president says his country is facing an attempted coup

description: Rep. John Curtis beat out a crowded GOP primary field in Utah to win his party's nomination for U.S. Senate. While he's viewed as a moderate conservative, he's also trying to define his own identity.
title: Conservative moderate John Curtis wins the Utah GOP primary

description: States are looking for creative ways to help parents through addiction while keeping kids in familiar living situations. But such rehab programs require resources that states may not prioritize.
title: A Missouri rehab program struggles amid a spike of child fentanyl deaths

description: The first contingent of Kenyan police officers arrive in Haiti after months of delays. The multinational force is there to curb gangs that have taken over most of the Haitian capital to bring order.
title: Will Kenyan police officers be able to wrest back control of Haiti from gangs?

description:
Rep. Jamaal Bowman faced a competitive primary due to his criticism of the Israel-Hamas
war. His primary challenger had the support and financial backing of AIPAC and much of the local establishment.
title: George Latimer defeated Democratic Congressman Jamaal Bowman in New York's primary

description: Kenya's president axed the bill after large demonstrations, in which rights groups say police shot at protesters and more than 20 people were killed. But protesters vow to march on.
title: Kenya's president has withdrawn the controversial tax bill after deadly protests

description: Former President Donald Trump has a debate style all his own. It's brash and aggressive while trying to project dominance. At Thursday's presidential debate, he might be limited by a mute button.
title: What Biden and Trump do could matter as much as what they say in tomorrow's debate

description: NPR's Ari Shapiro talks with Dr. Adam Hamawy, a former U.S. Army combat surgeon, who went before Congress Wednesday to describe patients they've treated while providing medical care in Gaza.
title: Surgeon who saved Sen. Duckworth says he couldn't save her with those wounds in Gaza

description: A breakdown in law and order along a main route in southern Gaza has made Israel's daytime fighting pause ineffectual for aid delivery. This led to skyrocketing food prices sold on the black market.
title: Looting in Gaza has led to skyrocketing food prices

description: Biden and Trump last shared the stage at two presidential debates in September and October 2020 (a third was canceled due to COVID). Here's how it all it went — and what's different this time around.
title: COVID tests and crosstalk: What happened the last time Trump and Biden debated

description: U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich is on trial for espionage in Russia. A mysterious metallic monolith appeared in Las Vegas this month.
title: Jailed U.S. reporter's Russian trial begins. A strange monolith appears near Las Vegas

description: Homeland Security says border arrests are falling to January 2021 averages
title: Border arrests fall more than 40% since Biden's halt to asylum processing

description: Iris, whose webcam has 20,000+ followers, has hatched chicks for the first time in five years. She's one of the worlds oldest known osprey, age 28, despite feeding from a giant superfund site.
title: Followers of Iris the osprey celebrate her chicks hatching

description: NPR's A Martinez asks Alan Rusbridger, former editor-in-chief of The Guardian, about the legacy of Julian Assange, and the 2010 WikiLeaks publication of classified government information.
title: What did WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange change by releasing classified documents?

description: After a while, even the most exciting relationships, jobs and environments lose their spark. But cognitive neuroscientist Tali Sharot says it's possible to fall back in love with life's small joys.
title: Stuck in a rut? How to appreciate your life again, according to science

description: Climate change has been a central focus in Joe Biden's first term. But fossil fuels have also flourished, and meeting the country's climate goals would require even bigger steps in a second term.
title: Biden has taken more action on climate than any president. His pitch? It creates jobs

description: Metallic prisms have been appearing across the world since one was found in Utah in 2020, but in many cases it’s still unclear who created them and why.
title: Another monolith appeared near Las Vegas. Who's behind these mysterious objects?

description: Illegal "sideshows," also known as "street takeovers," have spread since the pandemic. When police try to break them up, they often face defiant crowds
title: As sideshows gain popularity, police try a range of tactics to stop them in their tracks

description: Cicadas are the song of the summer, but this year’s large broods may be especially irritating for people on the autism spectrum who have hearing sensitivity.
title: Chorus or cacophony? Cicada song hits some ears harder than others

description: Christian writer Jonathan Merritt's new book My Guncle and Me tells the story of a gay uncle who helps his nephew embrace being different.
title: Christian writer's new book reminds kids what makes them different makes them special

description: When Karen Muller's father passed away, she was overwhelmed by the prospect of clearing out her parents' home. Then a family friend stepped in.
title: She was overwhelmed by clearing out her parents' belongings. Then a friend stepped in

description: On Capitol Hill, Michael Phelps and fellow Olympic swimming star Alison Schmitt testified about doping by elite Chinese athletes and demanded reforms to the World Anti-Doping Agency.
title: Swimmer Michael Phelps says China doping scandal threatens the Olympic movement

description: The brain appears to rely on synchronized waves to wash out waste products, including toxins associated with Alzheimer's disease.
title: The brain makes a lot of waste. Now scientists think they know where it goes

description: Meet the dogs who just finished the ATF's canine training program. ATF dogs have supported major events like the Super Bowl and are also used in the bread-and-butter of ATF's work: solving gun crimes.
title: These best boys and girls just graduated from the ATF's National Canine Academy

description: The espionage trial for Gershkovich, a Wall Street Journal correspondent, has begun in Russia’s Ural mountain capital of Yekaterinburg. That’s the same city where he was detained 15 months ago.
title: American journalist Evan Gershkovich is on trial for espionage in Russia

description: Democratic Rep. Jaamal Bowman of New York faced a primary defeat in a race that revealed divisions within his own party over the war in Gaza.
title: Rep. Bowman loses in New York Democratic primary shaped by Israel-Hamas war

description: The situation remains tense in Kenya after protesters were killed when police fired on crowds demonstrating against proposed tax increases
title: Deadly protests break out in Kenya’s capital Nairobi over proposed tax hikes

description: On this day before the presidential candidates debate, we have some debate prep for voters. Tuesday's briefing was on immigration -- and now the issue is the economy.
title: One of the hot button issues in the presidential debate will be the economy

description: Devastating flooding has forced residents in Northwest Iowa to flee their homes. Now efforts are underway to decide what can be salvaged, and what will be left behind.
title: Iowa's hardest hit communities are combing through flood damage

description: The NBA draft begins Wednesday night, and this year the son of superstar LeBron James is the lead story.
title: Would an NBA team draft the son of Lebron James if it helps them sign his father?

description: People in New Delhi are suffering because of a heat wave, and with it, water shortages. The party that governs New Delhi accuses a neighboring state of withholding water to punish the capital.
title: A politician in India goes on a hunger strike to demand water from an upstream state

description: NPR's Steve Inskeep talks with Yohanan Plesner of the Israel Democracy Institute about the Israeli court decision that lifts a military service exemption for ultra-orthodox men.
title: Israel's Supreme Court rules that the military must begin drafting ultra-Orthodox men

description: Deadly protests over Kenya tax hikes. Republican vice presidential candidates make their final pitch to Donald Trump. U.S. journalist Evan Gershkovich stands trial for espionage in Russia.
title: Morning news brief

description: Author Mike Curato wrote Flamer as a way to help young queer kids, like he once was, better understand and accept themselves. It was met with immediate praise and accolades — until it wasn't. When the book got caught up in a wave of Texas-based book bans, suddenly the narrative changed. And like so many books that address queer identity, Flamer quickly became a flashpoint in a long, messy culture war that tried to distort the nature of the book.
title: The truth and lies behind one of the most banned books in America
